content:
• Monday, November 19, 2018
  • PTN

    Palatin Tech +8.8% as CEO, COO/CFO disclose share purchases

    • Palatin Technologies (NYSEMKT:PTN) is up 8.8% postmarket after two C-suite leaders disclosed stock purchases from this week.
    • In a Form 4 filing, the company notes CEO Carl Spana purchased 20,000 shares on Friday at an average price of $0.7883. The move leaves him with beneficial ownership of 4,348,102 shares.
    • CFO/COO Stephen Wills also acquired 20,000 shares on Friday, a separate filing notes. He's left with 3,918,239 shares after that purchase.
    • Shares had fallen 11.8% during the regular session today.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 14 Comments
  • PSTG

    Earnings related companies tops after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: PSTG +6.9%. A +5.6%. URBN +5.1%. PEN +3.9%. NTNX +2.5%.
    • Top Losers: BRKS -7.3%. LB -3.5%. VST -2.0%. XOG -1.9%. GRPN -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • LB

    L Brands -7% after guidance update, dividend cut

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB) says it expects Q4 EPS of $1.90 to $2.10 vs. $1.99 consensus and full-year EPS $2.60 to $2.80 from $2.45 to $2.70 prior.
    • The company also expects to reduce its annual dividend to $1.20 from $2.40 currently, beginning with the quarterly dividend to be paid in March of 2019.
    • LB -6.55% AH.
    • Previously: L Brands beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 48 Comments
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage +6% on Q3 beats, in-line guides, new AWS suite

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG) gains 6.4% on Q3 results that beat EPS estimates with $0.13 and revenue estimates with $372.8M (+34% Y/Y). Q4 guidance has revenue from $438M to $446M (consensus: $440.6M) with gross margin of 64.5% to 67.5% and operating margin of 8% to 12%.
    • In-line FY18 guidance has revenue of $1.376B to $1.384B (consensus: $1.37B).
    • Revenue breakdown: Product, $298.9M (consensus: $293.8M); Support, $73.9M (consensus: $72.9M).
    • Non-GAAP gross margin was 68.1% and operating margin came in at 9.1%.
    • FCF totaled $28.5M or $30.6M without the ESPP impact.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Pure Storage beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Nov. 19)
    • Update: Pure Storage also announces Pure Storage Cloud Data Services, a suite of cloud offerings that run on Amazon Web Services.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • JACK

    Jack In The Box edges higher after mixed FQ4

    • Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) reports company comparable sales increased 0.5% in FQ4 vs. +1.0% consensus. Franchise comparable sales were up 0.8% vs. +1.1% consensus.
    • Adjusted EBITDA was reported at $54.0M vs. $57.3M.
    • Restaurant-Level EBITDA increased by 3000 bps to 26.1% of sales. The company says the increase was due primarily to the benefit of refranchising, partially offset by wage inflation, higher costs for food and packaging and higher maintenance and repairs expenses.
    • Food and packaging costs increased in the quarter due primarily to unfavorable product mix and higher costs for ingredients, partially offset by menu price increases.
    • CEO update: "Same-store sales were positive in the fourth quarter, although we experienced a slowdown in September along with the rest of the category. The competitive environment remains extremely aggressive, but we continue to avoid deep discounting which we believe is not in the best interests of the long-term health of the brand."
    • Looking ahead, Jack In The Box expects FY19 system-wide same-store sales growth of 2.0% and EBITDA of $260M to $270M vs. $264M consensus.
    • Previously: Jack In The Box misses by $0.08, beats on revenue (Nov. 19)
    • JACK +1.05% AH to $80.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa hits lowest in 16 months amid aluminum demand concerns

    • Alcoa (NYSE:AA) tumbled to its lowest since June 2017, tumbling as much as 10% to $32.25 before closing with a 6.7% loss at $33.49, as aluminum prices fall amid concerns demand may slow at a time when supply prospects are improving.
    • Century Aluminum (NASDAQ:CENX) sank as much as 7.3% before settling 5% lower at $8.87.
    • "The global economy is slowing," and traders are "reflecting this bearish macroview by selling the aluminum shares, even going short," says Harbor Intelligence managing director Jorge Vazquez, adding that in the U.S., the decline in the homebuilder index by the most since 2014 adds to worries over a global slowdown.
    • ETFs: FOIL, JJUB
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 8 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit +6% on Q1 beats, upside guide

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) gains 6.4% on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a reported $0.29 and $1.01B (+11% Y/Y), respectively.
    • Revenue breakdown: Product, $347M; Services, $669M.
    • QuickBooks Online subscribers grew 41% in the period to 3.6M.
    • Upside Q2 guidance has revenue from $1.47B to $1.49B (consensus: $1.45B) with EPS of $0.85 to $0.88 (consensus: $0.77).
    • In-line FY18 guidance reaffirmed with revenue of $6.53B to $6.63B (consensus: $6.61B) and EPS of $6.40 to $6.50 (consensus: $6.48).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Intuit beats by $0.18, beats on revenue (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters +3% after posting strong Q3 sales

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) reports comparable sales increased 7.0% in Q3 to miss the expectation of analysts for a 7.3% increase. Total sales rose 9% to a record $974M.
    • Comparable retail segment sales growth by brand: Free People +12%, Urban Outfitters +7%, Anthropologie Group +8%.
    • Wholesale segment sales were up 12% during the quarter.
    • Gross profit improved 130 bps to 34.7% of sales as costs were leveraged down.
    • SG&A expenses fell 40 bps to 24.8% of sales.
    • Net income rose to 5.1% of sales vs. 4.2% a year ago.
    • Shares of Urban Outfitters are up 3.12% in AH trading to $36.73
    • Previously: Urban Outfitters beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • JACK

    Jack In The Box misses by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Jack In The Box (NASDAQ:JACK): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.77 misses by $0.08; GAAP EPS of $0.68 misses by $0.19.
    • Revenue of $177.47M (-23.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.2M.
    • Shares +1.71%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit beats by $0.18, beats on revenue

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.18; GAAP EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.27.
    • Revenue of $1.01B (+11.0% Y/Y) beats by $40.76M.
    • Shares +1.3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne +3% as SunTrust issues two-notch upgrade to Buy

    • Helmerich & Payne (HP +2.8%) is higher after SunTrust upgrades shares two notches to Buy from Sell with a $75 price target, lifted from $58, saying the recent correction in its stock price has created an attractive entry point.
    • While most oilfield services names anticipate a pause in activity over their upcoming few quarters, HP has the "contracts in hand" to continue delivering "12 super-spec rig upgrades per quarter" into Q2 of next year, says SunTrust's Ken Sill, who also points to the company's dividend providing downside protection for the stock price and for its "strong balance sheet" to provide an advantage when the new rig build cycle starts in FY 2020.
    • Also, Citigroup upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $74 price target, up from $70, believing HP "offers a great combination of offensive and defensive qualities," and Credit Suisse raises the stock to Neutral from Underperform, citing the economic benefit of superspec rigs and the surety of the dividend.
    • Earlier: Helmerich & Payne +4% as quarterly revenue rises 31% Y/Y (Nov. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TWLO

    Cloud stocks drop with tech woes

    • Cloud stocks take a beating today on a generally rough day for tech following reports of another Apple iPhone order cut and Nvidia's crypto mining-related inventory issues.
    • The First Trust Cloud Computing ETF (NASDAQ:SKYY) is down 3.6%.
    • Among the movers: (TWLO -13.5%), (CRM -9%), (SPLK -11.3%), (ZUO -14.1%), (OKTA -15%), (SCWX -5.7%), (ZEN -12.3%), (NOW -8.5%), (HUBS -14.2%), (HDP -8.2%), (CLDR -7.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 25 Comments
  • SNAP

    Report shows Snap's Spiegel unworried by Wall Street; shares -7.2%

    • An insider view of board talks at Snap (NYSE:SNAP) comes from The Information on a day where the stock's down another 7.2% and retesting last month's all-time low.
    • The article paints a picture of a CEO (Evan Spiegel) unconcerned with the stock or the worries of Wall Street, preferring to focus instead on the very long term.
    • During a period when board meetings could be tense, now ex-director Mitch Lasky would challenge Spiegel about expectations, while Spiegel (who the piece says spent board meetings messaging others on Snapchat) accused Lasky and other opponents of focusing too much on the short term.
    • Spiegel chose to focus on the next 10 years of Snap's evolution, but having drawn a rough billion-dollar bonus for taking the company public, he's facing questions from those close to him about whether he has the detailed plan to make it to that 10 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 6 Comments
  • TGA

    TransGlobe Energy unveils positive test results from Eqypt exploration well

    • TransGlobe Energy (TGA +2.7%) is higher after test results from its South Ghazalat 6X exploration well in Egypt’s Western Desert showed the well flowing at a combined rate of 3,840 bbl/day of light oil from the Upper and Lower Bahariya formations.
    • TGA President Randy Neely says the company's "perseverance in the Western Desert has been rewarded with a light oil discovery and very encouraging test rates."
    • Based on the "positive" test rates, TGA says it will begin preparing a development plan for the discovery and evaluate additional exploration and appraisal drilling in the area to accelerate potential early development options.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 11 Comments
  • JD

    JD.com -8.5% to multi-year low; Stifel cuts to Hold

    • JD.com (JD -8.5%) is hitting 2.5-year lows on Nasdaq after today's earnings report showed deceleration in customer growth and missed revenue numbers.
    • Stifel Nicolaus is trimming its rating to Hold from Buy, noting a "slowing macroeconomic backdrop in China coupled with intense e-commerce competition"; the stock's trading well below peers but analyst Scott Devitt is moving to the sidelines based on limited visibility into issues including key-person risk. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He's lowered his price target to $26 from $32, now implying 23% upside.
    • If you're looking for a play on a turnaround in Chinese sentiment, pick Alibaba (BABA -2.5%), he suggests.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 123 Comments
  • ANY

    Technology movers: Sphere 3D leads gainers, while Remark Holdings leads the losers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +14%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +11%. Zayo Group Holdings (NYSE:ZAYO) +10%. Internet Gold Golden Lines (NASDAQ:IGLD) +10%. Atomera (NASDAQ:ATOM) +10%.
    • Losers: Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -18%. Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) -15%. Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) -15%. HubSpot (NYSE:HUBS) -14%. Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMZN

    AWS develops new services amid open-source pushback

    • Amazon (AMZN -4.3%) continues to use open-source software to build out AWS despite tensions with the open-source community, according to The Information.
    • AWS is reportedly developing two new cloud services based on popular database MongoDB (MDB -12%) and real-time data software Apache Kafka.
    • Open-source software is free to use with the expectation that the user will contribute code back to the community.
    • Last month, MongoDB changed its licensing to put the Community Server software under a SSPL license, which lets cloud providers offer MongoDB as a service but only if they open source all of the related code or create a commercial agreement.
    • AWS will host its re:Invent cloud conference next week in Las Vegas.
    • Previously: MongoDB issues new open source license (Oct. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 6 Comments
  • STNE

    StoneCo gets some attention--one buy, two neutrals

    • Three analysts start coverage of StoneCo. (NASDAQ:STNE) with two analysts rating the stock at neutral, while another issuing a buy rating.
    • JPMorgan initiates the Brazilian fintech company at neutral with a $25 price target and Goldman Sachs rates it a neutral with a $25.60 price target.
    • Citigroup initiates at a buy rating with a $30 price target.
    • StoneCo skids 13% on a bad day for fintechs overall--Global X FintTech ETF (FINX -5.7%).
    • Previously: Square's 10% decline leads fintech lower (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ENB

    Enbridge Line 3 pipeline project reaffirmed by Minnesota regulator

    • Minnesota's Public Utilities Commission reaffirms its support for Enbridge's (ENB +2.6%) proposal to replace its aging Line 3 crude oil pipeline across the state, rejecting a motion by opponents to reconsider its previous decision to grant a certificate of need for the project.
    • The PUC says ENB has met several additional conditions it imposed when approving the plan in June, including requirements for insurance coverage against spills and financial assurances for covering the costs of removing the pipeline at the end of its life.
    • The project still must obtain a number of permits before construction, and opponents say they will take their appeals to Gov.-elect Tim Walz.
    • Once completed, the pipeline will carry 760K bbl/day of oil across northern Minnesota on its route from Alberta to ENB's terminal in Superior, Wis.; the company began working three years ago to get the project approved.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 5 Comments
  • GE

    GE can cut debt, improve valuation by 2020, UBS analyst says

    • General Electric (GE -1.6%) will be able to reduce its debt "to far more acceptable levels by 2020" despite fears that the company's bonds could soon become junk-rated, says UBS analyst Steven Winoker, maintaining his conviction that the stock "presents a long-term capital appreciation opportunity."
    • While GE faces a number of risks to improving its leverage, and "it won't be quick, and it is likely to be volatile," but Winoker says he sees "a path to improvement for both leverage and valuation."
    • Winoker's outlook has GE garnering ~$33B from announced and coming asset sales while paying down $5.4B in debt and obligations and transferring $21B in cash to heavily levered GE Capital.
    • UBS rates GE as a Buy with a $13 stock price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 73 Comments
  • SQ

    Square's 10% decline leads fintech lower

    • The Nasdaq is down 3%, and Dow and S&P 500 just under 2% 100 minutes before the closing bell.
    • Taking particular punishment are a couple of now-previously hot fintech names, Square (SQ -9.5%) and PayPal (PYPL -5.1%).
    • Among other holdings of the Global X FinTech ETF (FINX -5.9%): Fiserv (FISV -2.1%), Intuit (INTU -6.9%), Fidelity National Information (FIS -3.1%)
    • ETFs: IPAY, FINX
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 32 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook near 2-year low amid 'crisis'; has it hit 'AOL/Yahoo peak'?

    • Facebook's (FB -5.6%) plumbing new 2-year lows as the stock heads for its worst month in nearly five years, and angel investor Jason Calacanis for one thinks these are crisis times for the iconic social network.
    • Looking at four stakeholders, he tells CNBC that advertisers still love the platform, but shareholders want out; employee morale is incredibly low and founders who sold their companies to CEO Mark Zuckerberg are sharply critical; and governments around the world may not put up with their "democracies being compromised."
    • "Put those four stakeholders together, this is a true crisis for Facebook," he says. "It's possible, maybe not probable but possible, this could be their AOL peak, their Yahoo peak."
    • Those companies peaked with hundreds of millions of users (30M-plus paid users in AOL's case) and it took a decade or two for them to deprecate, he notes. "Facebook's a whole different scale, 2.5B people, so I don't think they're going anywhere anytime soon, and advertisers love it."
    • But "put it all together, you don't want to own the stock, you don't want to work at the company ... so that's pretty dark ... I don't know that there's an easy solution other than grinding it out for the next 3-4 years," just like they did with the mobile ad problem, he says.
    • Of the "great partnership" of Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg, Calacanis says it seems one has to stay and one's gonna go -- and that means Zuckerberg stays ("He's the god-king") and Sandberg exits in the coming year to work on her political career.
    • Previously: WSJ: Zuckerberg aggressive with Facebook at war (Nov. 19 2018)
    • Previously: Sonnenfeld: Facebook should replace 'dispensable' COO Sandberg (Nov. 16 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 133 Comments
  • LLEX

    Lilis Energy and Resolute Energy among Energy/Materials gainers; PermRock Royalty and Alcoa among losers

    • Gainers: Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +19%. Resolute Energy (NYSE:REN) +14%. Natural Resource Partners (NYSE:NRP) +9%. QEP Resources (NYSE:QEP) +9%. NCS Multistage (NASDAQ:NCSM) +8%.
    • Losers: PermRock Royalty Trust (NYSE:PRT) -18%. Alcoa (NYSE:AA) -10%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) -9%. Tellurian (NASDAQ:TELL) -9%. VAALCO Energy (NYSE:EGY) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • QURE

    UniQure introduces new gene therapy candidates at R&D Day

    • UniQure (QURE -5.9%) debuted three new pipeline candidates at its R&D Day in New York this morning.
    • AMT-180: an intravenously administered AAV5-based gene therapy for the one-time treatment of hemophilia A which it says has shown the ability to circumvent FVIII inhibitors in preclinical testing.
    • AMT-190: an intravenously administered AAV5-based gene therapy for the one-time treatment of Fabry disease, designed to circumvent α-galactosidase A (GLA) antibodies.
    • AMT-150: an intrathecally (into the spinal canal) administered AAV gene therapy for the one-time treatment of spinocerebellar ataxia type 3 (SCA3), a rare inherited movement disorder with no current treatments.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior Living -10% after RBC extends horizon to 2020

    • Brookdale Senior Living (NYSE:BKD) slumps 10% after RBC analyst Frank Morgan cuts his target price to $8 from $9, saying the stock is "more like a 2020 story" despite "tangible results" from its restructuring efforts.
    • Reiterates sector perform rating.
    • Lower-than-expected Q3 adjusted EBITDA reflects occupancy pressure in a market that's experiencing oversupply of senior housing and labor costs increases, Morgan writes.
    • On the positive side, retention rate among community executives is above 70%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 4 buys; 2 holds; 1 underperform/sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • LEJU

    Leju Holdings leads financial gainers; PagSeguro and Green Dot among losers

    • Gainers: Leju Holdings (NYSE:LEJU) +18%. Consumer Portfolio Services (NASDAQ:CPSS) +7%.
    • Losers: PagSeguro Digital (NYSE:PAGS) -8%. China Rapid Finance (NYSE:XRF) -7%. Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) -7%. EZCORP (NASDAQ:EZPW) -7%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • TSRO

    Tesaro up 9% after exit from investor conference

    • Fresh off its 31% move on Friday, TESARO (TSRO +8.7%) is up again, this time on more than double normal volume, in reaction to its cancelation of an upcoming presentation at a healthcare conference, another signal of a potential M&A deal.
    • PARP competitor Clovis Oncology (CLVS -0.7%) has yet to experience parallel buying, normally the case.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 14 Comments
  • HUSKF

    All Newfoundland and Labrador offshore oil rigs shut down after Husky spill

    • Husky Energy (OTCPK:HUSKF -2.8%) is lower after the agency that regulates offshore safety in Newfoundland and Labrador shut down all offshore oil rigs in the province’s waters after an estimated 250 cm of oil leaked into the sea near St. John’s.
    • Husky says the spill happened Friday when a production, storage and offloading vessel "experienced a loss of pressure" in an oil flowline.
    • A Husky spokesperson said earlier that rough seas were hindering workers from containing the spill but noted there was no indication the spill could reach land.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 7 Comments

  • Tech lunch break: Apple cuts, Nvidia build add pressure

    • Another report of Apple iPhone production cuts drives down suppliers. Concerns about Nvidia's inventory build after the crypto mining boom went bust help Apple weigh down chips.
    • The sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) and S&P 500 IT Index are down 3.3% while the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index drops 2.6%. The pull of Apple and continued controversy at Facebook have pulled the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 down 2.8%. Tech's numbers compare to the 1.6% decline for the S&P 500 and 2.6% plunge for the Nasdaq.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
    • Previously: WSJ: Zuckerberg aggressive with Facebook at war (Nov. 19)
    • Previously: Nvidia's inventory clear could take quarters - WSJ (Nov. 19)
    • Previously: Another Apple production cut - WSJ (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 12 Comments
  • AKER

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Akers Biosciences (NASDAQ:AKER) +67%. Yulong Eco-Materials (NASDAQ:YECO-OLD) +23%. Leju Holdings (NYSE:LEJU) +18%. MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG) +18%. Resolute Energy (NYSE:REN) +16%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +14%. Internet Gold Golden Lines (NASDAQ:IGLD) +13%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +13%. Sphere 3D Corp. (NASDAQ:ANY) +12%. EnviroStar (NYSEMKT:EVI) +10%.
    • Losers: Diversicare Healthcare Services (NASDAQ:DVCR) -22%. Spectrum Brands Holdings (NYSE:SPB) -22%. Arcimoto (NASDAQ:FUV) -22%. Sonoma Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNOA) -21%. PermRock Royalty Trust (NYSE:PRT) -19%. Innovate Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INNT) -15%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -15%. Orchard Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ORTX) -15%. Colfax (NYSE:CFX) -14%.
    • Mesa Air Group, Inc. (NASDAQ:MESA) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • KAYS

    Kaya Holdings on go to develop cannabis production site in Oregon; shares up 5%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Kaya Holdings (OTCQB:KAYS +5%) is up on average volume on the heels of its announcement that it has prevailed in its appeal of a rejected application by Oregon authorities to develop and build an 80,000 sq. ft. indoor/outdoor cannabis production facility on its 26-acre farm in Lebanon.
    • It also announces that it will file its 10-Q for the quarter ended September 30 with the SEC later today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZS

    Zscaler -13% after $194K insider sale

    • Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) drops 13% after Friday's disclosure that CTO Amit Sinha disposed of 3,423 shares at the average price of $40.16 and 1,384 shares at $41.11.
    • Transactions total about $194.4K.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 16 Comments
  • AAPL

    Cook calls Google best search engine

    • Apple's (AAPL -3.7%) Tim Cook responds to criticism that the company takes billions from Google (GOOG -2.8%)(GOOGL -2.9%) while saying Apple sells products, not customer data.
    • The payments make Google the default search engine on Apple's products.
    • Cook, to Axios on HBO: "One, I think their search engine is the best. ... But, two, look at what we've done with the controls we've built in. We have private web browsing. We have an intelligent tracker prevention. What we've tried to do is come up with ways to help our users through their course of the day. It's not a perfect thing. I'd be the very first person to say that. But it goes a long way to helping."
    • Previously: Another Apple production cut - WSJ (Nov. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 46 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E shares, bonds resume slide on news of second outage prior to fire

    • PG&E (PCG -5.3%) shares fall again after the utility disclosed a second power line failure that occurred the same day the deadly fires in northern California first broke out.
    • PG&E bonds also are falling after Friday's reprieve; its 3.5% notes due in 2020 are trading 60 bps wider than at Friday's close, and 6.05% bonds due in 2034 are 15 bps wider, Bloomberg reports.
    • Morgan Stanley analysts see both "material upside" and big risk if California's largest utility were to undergo a breakup, and "the key risk is that the regulator (and potentially the legislature) would seek greater asset coverage for wildfire-related damages extending beyond the value of the electric utility."
    • The Camp Fire, which reportedly is ~65% contained, has killed at least 77 people so far, burned ~150K acres and destroyed more than 10K homes; heavy rain is forecast Wednesday, which could help fire fighters but raises the risk for mudslides because trees and brush have been lost.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • CGUIF

    Groupe Casino takes 5% stake in Lyf Pay

    • Group Casino (OTCPK:CGUIF) discloses that it's adding to its existing partnership with Lyf Pay and will take an initial stake of 5% in the molibe payment solution provider. Financial terms of the arrangement weren't disclosed.
    • The company says the Lyf Pay solution will be introduced in coming months at Le Petit Casino, Leader Price, Franprix, Monoprix and Naturalia.
    • "With this building-block partnership, the Casino Group and its banners are going to speed up joint development of a highly secure, digital mobile payment solution that will be available in all of the Group’s stores in France," says Casino digital exec Cyril Bourgois.
    • Shares of Groupe Casino closed up 1.1% today in Paris.
    • Groupe Casino press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • RTRX

    Nomura sees a two-bagger in Retrophin, shares up 2%

    • Retrophin (RTRX +2.1%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of a bullish call from Nomura/Instinet analyst Christopher Marai (BUY/$57) citing the upside from CSNA-001 in phenylketonuria (PKU), claiming that it works better than BioMarin Pharma's (BMRN -3.1%) Kuvan (sapropterin dihydrochloride) which generates ~$400M in annual sales.
    • According to the company's website, Phase 2-stage CSNA-001 is proprietary form of sepiaterin, a natural precursor to sapropterin (tetrahydrobiopterin or BH4), that it says may be more effective at increasing intracellular BH4 thereby inducing a greater reduction in excess phenylalanine (the amino acid that builds up in PKU).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM

  • TOL

    Higher rates hit housing hard in November

    • The NAHB Housing Market Survey isn't generally considered a top-tier economic report, but its plunge this month may end up being one of the more important stories of this economic cycle.
    • November's decline to 60 from 68 previously was the largest single-month drop in about four years. Expectations had been for just a minor slip to 67.
    • That housing has been hit hard by a combination of higher rates and rising prices isn't news - after all, the iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF (BATS:ITB) is down 30% this year (it's lower by 1% today following the NAHB report). But today's report - coming at a time when financial markets have been creaky and when the central planners at the Fed are just beginning to show some squeamishness about continuing with the rate hike cycle - might just be enough for the doves to prevent another move higher in rates at the December FOMC meeting.
    • Toll Brothers (TOL), Lennar (LEN -1.4%), Pulte (PHM -1%), KB Home (KBH -0.4%), D.R. Horton (DHI -1.9%).
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is flat at 3.065%. TLT, TBT flat
